title: Spaghetti Carbonara
summary: A classic Italian pasta dish with eggs, cheese, bacon, and black pepper.
instructions: Bring a large pot of salted water to boil and cook spaghetti according to package directions until al dente.
While pasta cooks, heat a large skillet over medium heat and cook pancetta until crispy, about 5-7 minutes.
Add minced garlic to the skillet and cook for 1 minute until fragrant.
In a bowl, whisk together eggs, grated cheeses, and black pepper.
Drain pasta, reserving 1/2 cup of pasta water.
Add hot pasta to the skillet with pancetta and garlic.
Remove skillet from heat and quickly stir in the egg mixture, adding reserved pasta water as needed to create a creamy sauce.
Serve immediately with extra cheese and black pepper on top.

title: Chicken Tikka Masala
summary: Chunks of grilled chicken (tikka) cooked in a smooth buttery & creamy tomato based gravy.
instructions: In a large bowl, mix yogurt, lemon juice, garam masala, cumin, coriander, turmeric, and chili powder.
Add chicken pieces and marinate for at least 2 hours or overnight in the refrigerator.
Preheat oven to 400°F (200°C). Place marinated chicken on a baking sheet and bake for 20-25 minutes until cooked through.
In a large skillet, heat oil over medium heat. Add onions and cook until soft and golden, about 8-10 minutes.
Add garlic and ginger, cook for 1 minute until fragrant.
Add crushed tomatoes and simmer for 10 minutes until thickened.
Stir in heavy cream and butter, then add the cooked chicken pieces.
Simmer for 10-15 minutes until sauce is creamy and chicken is well-coated.
Garnish with fresh cilantro and serve with rice or naan bread.

title: Classic Caesar Salad
summary: A crisp romaine lettuce salad with creamy Caesar dressing, croutons, and Parmesan cheese.
ingredients: Salt and black pepper to taste
instructions: In a small bowl, whisk together olive oil, garlic, Dijon mustard, lemon juice, and Worcestershire sauce.
Add minced anchovies if using, and season with salt and pepper.
In a large salad bowl, add chopped romaine lettuce.
Pour the dressing over the lettuce and toss gently to coat.
Add croutons and grated Parmesan cheese, then toss again.
Serve immediately with extra Parmesan cheese on top.
